name: Silken Diagonal Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: We booked for 6 nights and because it's been already charged the full amount, we couldn't get the chance to change. Room is ok but we had a first floor room, so a bit noisy... Internet has a very bad connection so we couldn't get access to all emails, and if you want a better connection, you have to pay... Witch doesn't make sense for the price they charge. Location is good, close to the Metro but I'm sure you can get a better deal than this. It's a pretty hotel, but nothing more than that.
reviews.title: Disappointed...Too expensive for what they offer...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is one of the more expensive hotels I've stayed in at 230 euro per night (special conference rate too mind you!) Not suitable as a business hotel, but the problems are entirely due to the management decisions of the hotel, as you can see by the issues I list. The staff were great, very efficient and helpful. Especially the night desk attendant who checked us in at half past midnight on 21st September and dealt with a crowd and busy telephone with patience and charm.
reviews.title: Funky is fine but must be functional too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (1) No iron/ ironing board in room. Rang to ask for an iron, room service brought a travel iron with a UK plug (?) fortunately we have a universal adapter but the iron did not work. Rang again and room service brought another with a european plug, but it was covered with scorch marks and burnt clothes residue. Trying to iron a short for a business meeting the next day on a table (not ironing board possible apparently) with a crap iron when arriving after midnight is not my idea of fun.
reviews.title: Location is very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: (2) bathroom arrangement - terrible!!. Glass walls around the bathroom area mean you are 'on display' when having a shower. Offputting to say the least. Also impossible not to flood the bathroom floor, as there is such a short glass screen around the bath and the bath surround does not allow draining back to the bath. I dread to think of the water damage that this must cause in the hotel. Lovely fixtures and fittings but implemented in an impractical stupid way.
reviews.title: Design hotel located in Barcelona 22@ area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (3) room not clean - sticky rings on the table and floor not vacuumed around the desk area.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, definitely staying here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed out four night stay in this hotel located near to Glories Metro and next door to the Gherkin-like Torre Agbar. The rooms are very comfortable with all you could need on a city break - very quiet and peaceful (good soundproofing) and stylish. Its a very smart traveller experience!
reviews.title: Very trendy hotel away from the crowds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Silken prior to our 5 night Royal Carribean cruise from Barcelona. The location was away from the major attraction, but the subway (Gracia) was around the corner and was extremely convenient to get around. From the airport we took a bus to Catalunya (8 euro for 2) and then a cab to the hotel which cost 10 euro.
reviews.title: Modern comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a strip mall across from the hotel, where they have clothing stores like Zara, H&M, and other Spanish brands and the french hypermarket called Carrefour. Euro was 1.60 to a 1 when we visted, so we shopped for basic food to save some $$ on breakfast. Their wine selection was quite large and inexpensive, with differnt selection of cava. We stocked up for our cruise there :). It's a great place to get gifts like Spanish Olive oil for family as well.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room at the Silken was very modern. I read the previous reviews and packed an extra soap/shampoo for myself, as they did kind of smell like male perfume. The bed was on the harder side but it wasn't too bad. I loved the rainfall shower, although you do need to be careful not to splash outside the tub.
reviews.title: Great find!

likes.liked: — Location - out of the melee but easy to access all transport.
likes.disliked: — Building work nearby but its an up and coming area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall with the money we paid it was a good stay. We booked directly through the hotel website and got a promotional rate $130 or so. Barcelona is a beautiful city so you're never in your room much!
reviews.title: Trendy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I love a good modern hotel, but some things do not need modernising: especially lifts. Whoever thought up the idea of having to punch your floor number into a pad BEFORE getting in the lift /elevator was really not thinking. You are then allocated lift A B or C for the floor you have punched, don't get in a lift which gets there first as there are no buttons in the actual lift! yes, weird, and worse is that the system seems to get confused and in the 2 days of my stay only in the middle of the night... the rooms were similarly over clever, too many switches with tiny tiny pictures supposedly to indicate their functions, fixtures a little ropey in places, breakfast great though! but that's nearly always the case in Spain
reviews.title: a little too clever with the modern touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall we had a very high level of service at this hotel. Our room was on the 4th floor and was very clean with plenty of space. The shower was excellent with plenty of hot water and our room was cleaned every day. Even though it is out of town, this hotel is next door to the metro so we could leave our hotel and be in Las Ramblas in no more than 15 mins. The tram line is just across the street so we went to the beach on the tram and it was also very convenient. And just directly across the street, we could take the city tour bus. So this is a really good location as it is not so noisy. Overall, I liked this hotel and I really liked the breakfasts with a wonderful selection of food available. What I liked least was that the dividing walls between the rooms appear to be quite thin, but our room was quiet so maybe we had quiet neighbours but this would not deter me from recommending it. there is a large shopping centre across the street also with a wonderful supermarket for all your food requirements.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Taxi fare from the airport was 27 Euros. We found this modern hotel a welcome change from the hotels we usually stay in around Las Ramblas.
reviews.title: A Different Aspect of Barcelona.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Check in was swift and very friendly. We speak a little Spanish and like to try it out when in Spain.. The reception staff were very kind and humoured us, although they spoke excellent English. We were given a street map.
reviews.title: Great hotel with all comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our bags were taken to our room on the 6th floor and the room was a corner room with 2 huge glass windows, it definately had the wow factor and a fantastic view across to the Sagrada Familia from one window. Electic blinds blacked out all light when closed and although situated on the busy Diaganol road, we weren't troubled by noise.
reviews.title: Spectacular and stylish .. won't break the bank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This fantastic hotel is all about form over function. It is undoubtedly the most stylish and modern hotel I have ever stayed in but unfortunately, some of the functions don’t work too well – the beautiful shower door leaks, the Jacuzzi bath doesn’t work and the touch screen computer in the amazing lifts give you the weather for February in the middle of April.
reviews.title: Form over function but great all the same

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Forget about all that though. The place is super. The rooms are great, the breakfasts are superb and the reception staff are all from the fantastically friendly Basque country which makes a pleasant change in the land of the miserable Catalans.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You might worry that the location is a little bit out of town, but don’t. It’s just 4 stops to Plaça Cataluña on the Met and a short tram ride to the Olympic Village. If you do need to do some local shopping / eating there is a Centre Commercial just over the road.
reviews.title: Modern, clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Memorable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights. We have been to Barcelona twice before so know the city quite well. We wanted to stay somewhere that had links to both the city centre and coast and this hotel was perfect. Situated next to a tram line to the coast and Glories metro station which runs into the city. The hotel was modern and clean. We paid for an upgraded room and had a sofa and seating area which would make the room more comfortable for an extended stay. It has a reasonably priced bar and mini bar facility in the room but a way too expensive buffet breakfast at 18 euros per person. However you can get a coffee and croissant for 3 euros in the cafe bar in the hotel (or use the local supermarket and eat in your room).
reviews.title: Modernist, Classy & right next to Torre Agbar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, a little bit outside center. 5 min with the metro ( easy) Swimming pool, yes but to small to swim in. The rooms where nice but the bath have no walls into the bedroom only glass. Soo if you are shy to the people you are travelling with ( daughter and son) then it is not okay. You can also hear noice fra the other rooms. But all in all nice hotel
reviews.title: Nice hotel with imperfections

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is not in the busy city centre but the metro is a 3 minute walk away and will bring you direclty to the centre of Barcelona. If you want to shop there is a shopping mall across the street with also some dining facilities.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel close to metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the rooftop terrace you have a nice view over the city. The swimming pool is on the small side, not good for doing laps.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, comfortable, and some have a nice view of the Agbor tower, Sagrada familia and the rest of the city. The only thing missing in the room is a coffee machine.
reviews.title: The Best Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet has plenty of choice and also a small diet corner. Downside is that it is every day the same. If you want you can also dine at the rooftop bar.
reviews.title: Disappointing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Well located hotel, right next on The Avenida Diagonal next to the Torre Agbar. The hotel lobby is small and has an intimate feel, with very friendly staff at reception, and everyone seemed comfortable with English. 2 minutes walk to the Glories station which is 4 stops (<10 mins) from Catalunya Square, and another 4 stops to Espanya. About 20 mins walk to the Sagrada Familia, and 15 mins to the beachfront. There is a nice shopping mall opposite with a selection of restaurants, so no worries about getting provisions or food.
reviews.title: Quirky but good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are compact but comfortable and I had a corner room which was bright and airy. The main quirk is that the bathroom is bright and airy as well, covered only in glass (nope, no curtains or blinds), so you'd better be used to seeing your room-mate naked. The WC is covered though. Bathroom was functional but the glass divider is very small and you will get the floor wet when you shower. Had a full-sized safe with power supply, so I could put my laptop, Ipad and other valuables in comfortably. The safe was locked when I came in but on complaining, the service guy came and fixed it quickly. Work desk is tiny but does the job. There is free internet but is HTML-only (no POP/IMAP for your mails) and is terribly slow. You are encouraged to purchase 'premium internet' for an extra fee. Didn't try that.
reviews.title: Praetorian Marketing trip to Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet spread pretty good with free Cava for those who need their morning drink. There's also a counter where you can get a cake/croissant and coffee for a nominal charge if you are running late (which you are quite likely to be, as the evenings start and end pretty late here).
reviews.title: Quirky, stylish, colorful; fun and annoying at the same time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall a great hotel for the solo traveller. If you are travelling with anyone else, like I said earlier, make sure you are comfortable seeing each other naked!
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel it had amazing conference facilities right near the city centre of barcelona recommended for any business trips.
reviews.title: Nice hotel- bit overpriced
Served The Purpose
reviews.text: This hotel was fine. My husband and I came to Barcelona for an extended weekend and many hotels were unavailable for Saturday night due to the football game Barcelona played against Real Madrid. Hotel Silken seemed to be the only one available that was in our price range and met our criteria. It is a very clean hotel with a comfortable bed and pillows, great bathroom facilities, and a pretty view if located on a higher floor. The furniture is cheap and not taken care of very well for being a newer establishment. They provide shampoo and soaps along with other toiletry items and a hair dryer as well as a converter that is installed in the safe box. However, my biggest gripe about this hotel is the noises you hear at all hours of the day. The shades are mechanical and we could hear when those staying around us were raising their shades each time. Also, anytime someone is showering, the draining water can be heard. It sounds as if an airplane is flying overhead but it is the water! I'm a fairly heavy sleeper but this awoke me each morning. The staff was helpful to us each time we had questions. The location is good. Only 4 stops from Las Ramblas on the Metro and next to a shopping mall with eating establishments. For $200 a night I don't think it is worth it. My husband was not impressed at all. If you can stay here for cheaper then it is worth the price; however at $200 a nightI think it should be a little nicer. To sum it up, the quality is cheap.

reviews.title: perfect for a few days in the city.....
reviews.text: ....quite nice hotel....

reviews.title: Fab Hotel!!!
reviews.text: modern rooms in black & white design...very comfortable beds, nice view from the rooftop terrace, very good location (2 mins to the metro), phantastic breakfast...cava...spanish serano ham, actimel, fresh squized orange juice and lots of fresh fruits...empty plates are replaced within seconds...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights. Very smart layout, with dark hallway lighting. Rooms were very tidy, with full glass wall looking out.
reviews.title: Smart modern tidy light with a little walk to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooftop pool is more of a plunge, but great to have a rooftop to relax on.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but a little bit to far...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Taxi to the old town was about 7 Euros...which we needed to do frequently. There's not agreat deal to do around the hotel. Though the beach is only about 15/20 mins walk away.
reviews.title: I expected more from a 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Nice place but it is not exactly what I was waiting for a 4star hotel...
reviews.title: Too far from town and awful see-through bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The view from the top floor (swimming pool floor) was nice.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personally I enjoyed my stay at Silken Diagonal. The hotel isn't the cheapest, but our room was spacious, clean, comfortable, looked cool with its modern decor and had everything we could possibly think of needing. A/C functioned properly and I couln't hear any noice from the street either.
reviews.title: Modern and cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a four* hotel, so you do expect to find certain amenities, yet I still was positively surprised to find bathrobes and slippers placed in the bathroom. I suppose we had somekind of a superior room, but maybe the same things are available in all rooms. Only downside I can come up with is the location. Allthough Glories metrostation is very close, I would prefer walking distance to center and sights. Nevertheless, I recommend.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 6 days at the Silken Diagonal Hotel. Although the hotel is not located in the center of Barcelona, the Gloriés Metro Station is just a five minute walk away. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast is served from 7 tot 11 AM. You have a lot of different things to chose from. Even cava if you want to. The rooms are spacious and look nice, although some handles in the bathroom were hanging loose. On the top of the hotel is a swimming pool. But in reality it is much smaller than it appears to be on the internet or in folders. Be very careful when you leave your room. Make sure everything is locked in the safe or your suitcase. A poloshirt was stolen from our room. Although the staff talked it over with the cleaning service, we never saw it back. Hotel Silken Diagonal has the potential to be an excellent hotel, but some minor annoying circumstances made it for me to be just a good place to stay.
reviews.title: not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Nice friendly reception staff and porters.
reviews.title: Impressive, modern hotel and great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decent breakfast enough for every taste.
reviews.title: Interesting experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights before a Mediterranean Cruise and enjoyed our stay. As other travelers mentioned, it's right next to a large cone-shaped building that's pretty cool. We loved being able to
reviews.title: Decent place to stay in Barcelona

likes.disliked: — Room size (we have a family of 5)

reviews.title: Great Hotel overall...
reviews.text: see La Sagrada Familia from our window!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and the decor was nice. The bathroom walls are glass...but not the toilet (whew!)! Each room has one large bed for two people, so if you're traveling with 4 people, that will be two rooms. If you have three people, they do have some larger rooms with a couch that will accomodate that size group.
reviews.title: Loved Barcelona, not sure about hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast is phenomenal! There's a wide variety of fresh, hot food. Delicious fruit, eggs, meats, etc. It's all very good...even the coffee was wonderful!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

description: The Hotel Diagonal Barcelona, stands out for a modern architecture and its interior design. Barcelona architect Juli Capella, was responsible for the hotel’s design, including the imaginative play of black and white contrasts on its façade.Its exceptional location is another of the hotel’s main attractions, next to the impressive Agbar Tower. The newest skyscraper in this dynamic, cultural, Mediterranean city, it is the work of Jean Nouvel, one of today’s greatest architects.Inside, the hotel’s fresh and striking features will please guests seeking accommodation that is both exclusive, tasteful and in line with current design trends.The hotel’s location makes it convenient for the Conference Centre, main access roads, the port and the airport, and means you can reach the city centre in just a few minutes.And you get the best views of the city from its swimming pool…
